S

setAllRenderers(IScreen) - Static method in class me.fonts.src.Fonts
Rather than individually setting the IScreen of each Font, using this will set the IScreens for all Fonts.
setPixel(int, int, int) - Method in class me.fonts.graphics.SpriteBase
Sets a pixel's color at the specified location in the SpriteBase.
setScreen(IScreen) - Method in class me.fonts.src.Font
Sets the screen to render the Font to.
size() - Static method in class me.fonts.src.Fonts
Get the amount of fonts the FONTS array contains.
split(SpriteSheet, int, int) - Static method in class me.fonts.graphics.SpriteBase
Split an entire SpriteSheet into an array of SpriteBases, each the width and height of the provided.
SpriteBase - Class in me.fonts.graphics
An abstract class dedicated to holding the pixels of a SpriteSheet, or duplicating certain pixels.
SpriteBase() - Constructor for class me.fonts.graphics.SpriteBase
A default constructor, which will not normally be able to be called unless if you have a custom constructor in the subclass.
SpriteBase(int[], int, int) - Constructor for class me.fonts.graphics.SpriteBase
Clones the pixels, width, and height provided.
SpriteBase(SpriteBase) - Constructor for class me.fonts.graphics.SpriteBase
Clones a SpriteBase's width, height, and array.
SpriteSheet - Class in me.fonts.graphics
A class dedicated to retrieving the RGB values of images found in the Project's resources.
SpriteSheet(String) - Constructor for class me.fonts.graphics.SpriteSheet
Creates an instance of a SpriteSheet and will attempt to lead it according to the provided path.
STRING_COLOR - Static variable in class me.fonts.src.FontFormat.CodeBuilder
